result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Behlke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 days credit if revoked. If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L. Behlke

records.addlTxt: To defendant with copy of court appointed attorney bill and balance due.
Added attorney fees in amount of $200.00 due to Eau Claire County Clerk of Courts.
Attorney fees in the amount of $200.00 for Attorney Field.

10:23 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon L. Behlke in court with Attorney David W. Field. Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Court accepts the plea finds the Defendant guilty. 

Court withholds sentence and orders18 months probation, 60 days jail stayed pending further order of the court with Huber or Electronic Monitoring if available, maintain absolute sobriety, Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold, No contact with B.B. unless to discuss exchange with child (G.B.), no contact with B.B.'s children, A.B., H.B., B.M., K.O. No physical or verbal acts or threats of violence against B.B., Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and court costs. 

3 days of credit if revoked. Court orders cash bond be applied to court costs. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

10:01am Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon L. Behlke in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Brandon L. Behlke. There is not an agreement at this time. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/11/22 at 1:30pm
Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney David Field at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 07/01/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
